revised_title: Recursion Method for Electronic States in Complicated Materials
tldr: The article discusses the recursion method, a solution to the Schrödinger equation, for calculating electronic states in complicated materials. The method involves transforming the electronic hamiltonian into a tridiagonal matrix and constructing a set of basis orbitals. This process provides a convergent expansion of the energy resolvent as a continued fraction, which can be used to calculate physical quantities and express them in terms of sums of mutually avoiding quantum mechanical paths.
